title: How to write an invitation letter for a book launch - Quora

response.answer_text: Assuming this is your first book ever being published, you will want to introduce yourself. Always make yourself known before the first sentence is over. State important and relevant information about you, such as your name or pen name, what you are (an author), what you write (genre or theme), how long you’ve been writing (experience) and what you’re promoting. Depending on the type of book you’re publishing, match or convey the tone of your book in your invitation. If it’s a mystery, add some cryptic things about your book or about the potential interests that your recipients would have. If it’s a comedy, be funny. If it’s an adventure, be jolly. Act as though you’re writing a blurb about your blurb you made for the book, and the blurb is about either you, the audience’s preparation for the book or the book itself. Good luck with your new book!

If you’re an author it shouldn’t really be that hard. Firstly, be yourself, don’t try and come across like anyone else. And look at your later from the other person’s point of view, why should they give a damn about you and your book? What would make you as that person, set aside some time to come to a book launch? Everyone has the same mantra ‘What’s In It For Me,’ find a way to make it worth their while and you’ll have more people showing up
